OUR EDITORIAL PRINCIPLES	
1. Multiple Perspectives: Offer multiple perspectives from trusted sources and empower listeners to make up their own minds on where they stand on a topic.
2. Thought-provoking: Present audio articles that inform, inspire, and offer fresh insights, through both a global and a national lens. Focus on opinion, feature, and analysis articles.
3. Storytellers: Be storytellers and educators. Help our listeners understand global topics, and perspectives, while also telling the stories of the people behind the headlines.
4. Global Impact: Ensure coverage and raise awareness of important topics, regardless of a topics popularity or ability to drive “clicks”. 
5. Fourth Estate: Uphold journalism’s values as a democratic check on power. And always celebrate great journalism.
6. Embrace Complexity: Encourage thought and avoid black and white explanations that aren't followed with depth. The world is complicated and can seldom be explained in minutes. Our goal is to help listeners navigate it.

The Daily Edit automatically analyzes news articles and presents you with the unbiased news story as told by all publishers. Now you don't have to read several articles from different sources to build up the complete picture.

NEVER MISS IMPORTANT DETAILS
No matter what news source(s) you prefer to read, The Daily Edit reveals important additional details found in other articles. 

BE CONFIDENT WITH EVERY NEWS SOURCE
We use a proprietary article scoring system to rate every article.  That way you can be sure you're getting the complete picture. 

GET STORIES FROM ALL SOURCES
We don’t filter or discriminate news sources in any way. This ensures that you get the facts that matter for each story. 

AVOID MISLEADING TEXT
Our app highlights potentially misleading text so you don't have to. 

ALERTS THAT MATTER TO YOU
Easily create custom alerts for stories and topics that interest you. 

How it works: 
- We aggregate stories by topic like other news aggregators.
- Our algorithm reads each article on a story and gathers all of the details it found using artificial intelligence.
- We then assess each article in that story and identify which details it contained, and which it missed. 
- We also identify regions of potentially misleading text (e.g. missing data references, missing sources)
- We combine these metrics to form an assessment of the article.

The world needs facts, but when news travels faster than the speed of reason, we need a news technology solution to help make sense of it all. Join us in a new media revolution by checking out this app!


COMMITTED TO YOUR PRIVACY
The Daily Edit only uses on-device tracking to recommend stories and doesn’t access your information without your permission. We never share information with third parties or allow advertisers to track you.
 
Already a subscriber to The Daily Edit? Simply install the app and sign in with your Daily Edit login details.
The Daily Edit uses an advanced algorithm to measure the news, making sure that you get the full story no matter which source you choose to read.

HAVE MORE QUESTIONS?

Cummings, H.D., T.S. Eliot, Robert Frost, Langston Hughes, Marianne Moore, Sylvia Plath, and many others. Today, POETRY continues to present new work by recognized poets as well as new voices. Eduardo C. Corral, Rita Dove, Tarfia Faizullah, Terrance Hayes, Juan Felipe Herrera, Joy Harjo, Les Murray, Claudia Rankine, Solmaz Sharif, Danez Smith, Karen Solie, Ocean Vuong, and many others have been published in recent issues.

POETRY is also known for its enlivening book reviews, essays, and “The View from Here” column, which highlights artists, professionals, and others from outside the poetry world writing about their experience of poetry. Recent installments have included pieces by cartoonist Lynda Barry; musician Neko Case; novelist and essayist Roxane Gay; author of the “Lemony Snicket” children’s series, Daniel Handler; the late columnist Christopher Hitchens; hip-hop artist Che “Rhymefest” Smith; artist Ai Weiwei; and philosopher Slavoj Žižek. In recent years, the magazine has received three National Magazine Awards, one for its podcast and two for general excellence.
